@documentation.@comment: a provence-generating activity

@properties.id: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI
@properties.name: A human readable label for an entity

@documentation.@comment: a provence-generating agent

@properties.id: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI

@documentation.@comment: The value for any value of a attribute for a sample. This object can hold both the un-normalized atomic value and the structured value

@properties.has_raw_value: The value that was specified for an annotation in raw form, i.e. a string. E.g. "2 cm" or "2-4 cm"
@properties.type: An optional string that specifies the type object.  This is used to allow for searches for different kinds of objects.

@documentation.@comment: Biological source material which can be characterized by an experiment.

@properties.host_taxid: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606
@properties.embargoed: If true, the data are embargoed and not available for public access.
@properties.collected_from: The Site from which a Biosample was collected
@properties.type: An optional string that specifies the type object.  This is used to allow for searches for different kinds of objects.
@properties.img_identifiers: A list of identifiers that relate the biosample to records in the IMG database.
@properties.samp_name: A local identifier or name that for the material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. It can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. INSDC requires every sample name from a single Submitter to be unique. Use of a globally unique identifier for the field source_mat_id is recommended in addition to sample_name.
@properties.part_of: Links a resource to another resource that either logically or physically includes it.
@properties.id: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI
@properties.alternative_identifiers: A list of alternative identifiers for the entity.
@properties.gold_biosample_identifiers: identifiers for corresponding sample in GOLD
@properties.insdc_biosample_identifiers: identifiers for corresponding sample in INSDC
@properties.emsl_biosample_identifiers: A list of identifiers for the biosample from the EMSL database.  This is used to link the biosample, as modeled by NMDC, to the biosample in the planned EMSL NEXUS database.
@properties.igsn_biosample_identifiers: A list of identifiers for the biosample from the IGSN database.
@properties.abs_air_humidity: Actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture
@properties.add_recov_method: Additional (i.e. Secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.additional_info: Information that doesn't fit anywhere else. Can also be used to propose new entries for fields with controlled vocabulary
@properties.address: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.
@properties.adj_room: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room
@properties.aero_struc: Aerospace structures typically consist of thin plates with stiffeners for the external surfaces, bulkheads and frames to support the shape and fasteners such as welds, rivets, screws and bolts to hold the components together
@properties.agrochem_addition: Addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications
@properties.air_PM_concen: Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
@properties.air_temp: Temperature of the air at the time of sampling
@properties.air_temp_regm: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens
@properties.al_sat_meth: Reference or method used in determining Al saturation
@properties.alkalinity: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate
@properties.alt: Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
@properties.ammonium: Concentration of ammonium in the sample
@properties.ammonium_nitrogen: Concentration of ammonium nitrogen in the sample
@properties.amount_light: The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area
@properties.ances_data: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)
@properties.annual_precpt: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.
@properties.antibiotic_regm: Information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple antibiotic regimens
@properties.api: API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity) (e.g. 31.1¬∞ API)
@properties.arch_struc: An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction
@properties.aromatics_pc: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
@properties.asphaltenes_pc: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
@properties.atmospheric_data: Measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data
@properties.avg_dew_point: The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day
@properties.avg_occup: Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room.
@properties.avg_temp: The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day
@properties.bac_prod: Bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake
@properties.bac_resp: Measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column
@properties.barometric_press: Force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface
@properties.bathroom_count: The number of bathrooms in the building
@properties.bedroom_count: The number of bedrooms in the building
@properties.benzene: Concentration of benzene in the sample
@properties.biochem_oxygen_dem: Amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms in a body of water to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period
@properties.biocide: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration
@properties.biocide_admin_method: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days)
@properties.biomass: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements
@properties.biotic_regm: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
@properties.biotic_relationship: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object
@properties.blood_press_diast: Resting diastolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury
@properties.blood_press_syst: Resting systolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury
@properties.build_docs: The building design, construction and operation documents
@properties.build_occup_type: The primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used
@properties.building_setting: A location (geography) where a building is set
@properties.built_struc_age: The age of the built structure since construction
@properties.built_struc_set: The characterization of the location of the built structure as high or low human density
@properties.built_struc_type: A physical structure that is a body or assemblage of bodies in space to form a system capable of supporting loads
@properties.calcium: Concentration of calcium in the sample
@properties.carb_dioxide: Carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
@properties.carb_monoxide: Carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
@properties.carb_nitro_ratio: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen
@properties.ceil_area: The area of the ceiling space within the room
@properties.ceil_cond: The physical condition of the ceiling at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas
@properties.ceil_finish_mat: The type of material used to finish a ceiling
@properties.ceil_struc: The construction format of the ceiling
@properties.ceil_texture: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a ceiling surface
@properties.ceil_thermal_mass: The ability of the ceiling to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete that is exposed. A metal deck that supports a concrete slab will act thermally as long as it is exposed to room air flow
@properties.ceil_type: The type of ceiling according to the ceiling's appearance or construction
@properties.ceil_water_mold: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the ceiling
@properties.chem_administration: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi
@properties.chem_mutagen: Treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mutagen regimens
@properties.chem_oxygen_dem: A measure of the capacity of water to consume oxygen during the decomposition of organic matter and the oxidation of inorganic chemicals such as ammonia and nitrite
@properties.chem_treat_method: Method of chemical administration(dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling) (e.g. 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days)
@properties.chem_treatment: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included
@properties.chimera_check: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.
@properties.chloride: Concentration of chloride in the sample
@properties.climate_environment: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates
@properties.collection_date: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
@properties.crop_rotation: Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule
@properties.cult_root_med: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors.
@properties.cur_vegetation: Vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop
@properties.cur_vegetation_meth: Reference or method used in vegetation classification
@properties.date_last_rain: The date of the last time it rained
@properties.density: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density)
@properties.depos_env: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.depth: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
@properties.dew_point: The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.
@properties.diether_lipids: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids
@properties.diss_carb_dioxide: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample
@properties.diss_inorg_carb: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter
@properties.diss_inorg_phosp: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample
@properties.diss_iron: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample
@properties.diss_org_carb: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid
@properties.diss_org_nitro: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2
@properties.diss_oxygen_fluid: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic).
@properties.door_comp_type: The composite type of the door
@properties.door_cond: The phsical condition of the door
@properties.door_loc: The relative location of the door in the room
@properties.door_mat: The material the door is composed of
@properties.door_move: The type of movement of the door
@properties.door_water_mold: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a door
@properties.down_par: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column
@properties.drainage_class: Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system
@properties.drawings: The buildings architectural drawings; if design is chosen, indicate phase-conceptual, schematic, design development, and construction documents
@properties.ecosystem: An ecosystem is a combination of a physical environment (abiotic factors) and all the organisms (biotic factors) that interact with this environment. Ecosystem is in position 1/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_category: Ecosystem categories represent divisions within the ecosystem based on specific characteristics of the environment from where an organism or sample is isolated. Ecosystem category is in position 2/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_subtype: Ecosystem subtypes represent further subdivision of Ecosystem types into more distinct subtypes. Ecosystem subtype is in position 4/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_type: Ecosystem types represent things having common characteristics within the Ecosystem Category. These common characteristics based grouping is still broad but specific to the characteristics of a given environment. Ecosystem type is in position 3/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.efficiency_percent: Percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor
@properties.elev: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.
@properties.elevator: The number of elevators within the built structure
@properties.emulsions: Amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types
@properties.env_broad_scale: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class:  http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS
@properties.env_local_scale: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
@properties.env_medium: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
@properties.env_package: MIxS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported
@properties.environment_field: field describing environmental aspect of a sample
@properties.escalator: The number of escalators within the built structure
@properties.ethylbenzene: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample
@properties.exp_duct: The amount of exposed ductwork in the room
@properties.exp_pipe: The number of exposed pipes in the room
@properties.experimental_factor: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI
@properties.ext_door: The number of exterior doors in the built structure
@properties.ext_wall_orient: The orientation of the exterior wall
@properties.ext_window_orient: The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing
@properties.extreme_event: Unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations
@properties.fao_class: Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. The list can be found at http://www.fao.org/nr/land/sols/soil/wrb-soil-maps/reference-groups
@properties.fertilizer_regm: Information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name of fertilizer, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fertilizer regimens
@properties.field: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora)
@properties.filter_type: A device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants
@properties.fire: Historical and/or physical evidence of fire
@properties.flooding: Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding
@properties.floor_age: The time period since installment of the carpet or flooring
@properties.floor_area: The area of the floor space within the room
@properties.floor_cond: The physical condition of the floor at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas
@properties.floor_count: The number of floors in the building, including basements and mechanical penthouse
@properties.floor_finish_mat: The floor covering type; the finished surface that is walked on
@properties.floor_struc: Refers to the structural elements and subfloor upon which the finish flooring is installed
@properties.floor_thermal_mass: The ability of the floor to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations
@properties.floor_water_mold: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew in a room
@properties.fluor: Raw or converted fluorescence of water
@properties.freq_clean: The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.
@properties.freq_cook: The number of times a meal is cooked per week
@properties.fungicide_regm: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens
@properties.furniture: The types of furniture present in the sampled room
@properties.gaseous_environment: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens
@properties.gaseous_substances: Amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances
@properties.gender_restroom: The gender type of the restroom
@properties.genetic_mod: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection
@properties.geo_loc_name: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
@properties.gravidity: Whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used
@properties.gravity: Information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple treatments
@properties.growth_facil: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research
@properties.growth_habit: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species
@properties.growth_hormone_regm: Information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple growth hormone regimens
@properties.hall_count: The total count of hallways and cooridors in the built structure
@properties.handidness: The handidness of the individual sampled
@properties.hc_produced: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.hcr: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.hcr_fw_salinity: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS
@properties.hcr_geol_age: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.hcr_pressure: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource
@properties.hcr_temp: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource
@properties.heat_cool_type: Methods of conditioning or heating a room or building
@properties.heat_deliv_loc: The location of heat delivery within the room
@properties.heat_sys_deliv_meth: The method by which the heat is delivered through the system
@properties.heavy_metals: Heavy metals present in the sequenced sample and their concentrations. For multiple heavy metals and concentrations, add multiple copies of this field.
@properties.heavy_metals_meth: Reference or method used in determining heavy metals
@properties.height_carper_fiber: The average carpet fiber height in the indoor environment
@properties.herbicide_regm: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.horizon_meth: Reference or method used in determining the horizon
@properties.host_age: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees
@properties.host_body_habitat: Original body habitat where the sample was obtained from
@properties.host_body_product: Substance produced by the body, e.g. Stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) terms, please see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/fma or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon
@properties.host_body_site: Name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON
@properties.host_body_temp: Core body temperature of the host when sample was collected
@properties.host_diet: Type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types
@properties.host_family_relation: Familial relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships
@properties.host_growth_cond: Literature reference giving growth conditions of the host
@properties.host_last_meal: Content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values
@properties.host_life_stage: Description of life stage of host
@properties.host_phenotype: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP
@properties.host_sex: Gender or physical sex of the host.
@properties.host_subject_id: A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified.
@properties.host_subspecf_genlin: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.
@properties.host_substrate: The growth substrate of the host.
@properties.host_symbiont: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host.
@properties.host_tot_mass: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host
@properties.humidity: Amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling
@properties.humidity_regm: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.indoor_space: A distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used
@properties.indust_eff_percent: Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant
@properties.inorg_particles: Concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles
@properties.inside_lux: The recorded value at sampling time (power density)
@properties.int_wall_cond: The physical condition of the wall at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas
@properties.investigation_field: field describing aspect of the investigation/study to which the sample belongs
@properties.iw_bt_date_well: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery
@properties.iwf: Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling. (e.g. 87%)
@properties.last_clean: The last time the floor was cleaned (swept, mopped, vacuumed)
@properties.lat_lon: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
@properties.lbc_thirty: lime buffer capacity, determined after 30 minute incubation
@properties.lbceq: lime buffer capacity, determined at equilibrium after 5 day incubation
@properties.light_regm: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality.
@properties.light_type: Application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light
@properties.link_addit_analys: Link to additional analysis results performed on the sample
@properties.link_class_info: Link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information
@properties.lithology: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.local_class: Soil classification based on local soil classification system
@properties.local_class_meth: Reference or method used in determining the local soil classification
@properties.magnesium: Concentration of magnesium in the sample
@properties.manganese: Concentration of manganese in the sample
@properties.max_occup: The maximum amount of people allowed in the indoor environment
@properties.mean_peak_frict_vel: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity
@properties.mechanical_damage: Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites
@properties.methane: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
@properties.micro_biomass_meth: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass
@properties.microbial_biomass: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units
@properties.mineral_nutr_regm: Information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens
@properties.misc_param: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here
@properties.n_alkanes: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes
@properties.nitrate: Concentration of nitrate in the sample
@properties.nitrate_nitrogen: Concentration of nitrate nitrogen in the sample
@properties.nitrite: Concentration of nitrite in the sample
@properties.nitrite_nitrogen: Concentration of nitrite nitrogen in the sample
@properties.non_min_nutr_regm: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens
@properties.nucl_acid_amp: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids
@properties.nucl_acid_ext: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample
@properties.number_pets: The number of pets residing in the sampled space
@properties.number_plants: The number of plant(s) in the sampling space
@properties.number_resident: The number of individuals currently occupying in the sampling location
@properties.occup_density_samp: Average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage
@properties.occup_document: The type of documentation of occupancy
@properties.occup_samp: Number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space
@properties.org_count_qpcr_info: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles)
@properties.org_particles: Concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.
@properties.organism_count: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)
@properties.owc_tvdss: Depth of the original oil water contact (OWC) zone (average) (m TVDSS)
@properties.oxygen: Oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
@properties.particle_class: Particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values
@properties.pcr_cond: Description of reaction conditions and components of PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'
@properties.pcr_primers: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
@properties.permeability: Measure of the ability of a hydrocarbon resource to allow fluids to pass through it. (Additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permeability_(earth_sciences))
@properties.perturbation: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
@properties.pesticide_regm: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens
@properties.ph: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid
@properties.ph_meth: Reference or method used in determining ph
@properties.ph_regm: Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen
@properties.phaeopigments: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments
@properties.phosplipid_fatt_acid: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values
@properties.plant_growth_med: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary
@properties.plant_product: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from
@properties.plant_sex: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite.
@properties.plant_struc: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here.
@properties.pollutants: Pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant
@properties.pool_dna_extracts: Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given
@properties.porosity: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample
@properties.potassium: Concentration of potassium in the sample
@properties.pour_point: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point)
@properties.pre_treatment: The process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater
@properties.pres_animal_insect: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space.
@properties.pressure: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres
@properties.prev_land_use_meth: Reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates
@properties.primary_prod: Measurement of primary production, generally measured as isotope uptake
@properties.primary_treatment: The process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed
@properties.prod_rate: Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day)
@properties.profile_position: Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas
@properties.quad_pos: The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building
@properties.radiation_regm: Information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple radiation regimens
@properties.rainfall_regm: Information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.reactor_type: Anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage
@properties.redox_potential: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential
@properties.rel_air_humidity: Partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air
@properties.rel_humidity_out: The recorded outside relative humidity value at the time of sampling
@properties.rel_samp_loc: The sampling location within the train car
@properties.rel_to_oxygen: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments
@properties.resins_pc: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
@properties.room_air_exch_rate: The rate at which outside air replaces indoor air in a given space
@properties.room_architec_elem: The unique details and component parts that, together, form the architecture of a distinguisahable space within a built structure
@properties.room_condt: The condition of the room at the time of sampling
@properties.room_connected: List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway
@properties.room_count: The total count of rooms in the built structure including all room types
@properties.room_dim: The length, width and height of sampling room
@properties.room_door_dist: Distance between doors (meters) in the hallway between the sampling room and adjacent rooms
@properties.room_door_share: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a door with the sampling room
@properties.room_hallway: List of room(s) (room number, room name) located in the same hallway as sampling room
@properties.room_loc: The position of the room within the building
@properties.room_moist_dam_hist: The history of moisture damage or mold in the past 12 months. Number of events of moisture damage or mold observed
@properties.room_net_area: The net floor area of sampling room. Net area excludes wall thicknesses
@properties.room_occup: Count of room occupancy at time of sampling
@properties.room_samp_pos: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements
@properties.room_type: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure
@properties.room_wall_share: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a wall with the sampling room
@properties.room_window_count: Number of windows in the room
@properties.root_cond: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container.
@properties.root_med_carbon: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose.
@properties.root_med_macronutr: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170¬†mg/L).
@properties.root_med_micronutr: Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2¬†mg/L).
@properties.root_med_ph: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5.
@properties.root_med_regl: Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5¬†mg/L NAA.
@properties.root_med_solid: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar.
@properties.root_med_suppl: Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. nicotinic acid (0.5¬†mg/L).
@properties.salinity: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.
@properties.salinity_meth: Reference or method used in determining salinity
@properties.salt_regm: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens
@properties.samp_collec_device: The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).
@properties.samp_collec_method: The method employed for collecting the sample.
@properties.samp_collect_point: Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.samp_dis_stage: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen.
@properties.samp_floor: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located
@properties.samp_loc_corr_rate: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays
@properties.samp_mat_process: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.
@properties.samp_md: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.samp_preserv: Preservative added to the sample (e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde, etc.). Where appropriate include volume added (e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml)
@properties.samp_room_id: Sampling room number. This ID should be consistent with the designations on the building floor plans
@properties.samp_size: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.
@properties.samp_sort_meth: Method by which samples are sorted; open face filter collecting total suspended particles, prefilter to remove particles larger than X micrometers in diameter, where common values of X would be 10 and 2.5 full size sorting in a cascade impactor.
@properties.samp_store_dur: Duration for which the sample was stored
@properties.samp_store_loc: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room
@properties.samp_store_temp: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius
@properties.samp_subtype: Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.samp_taxon_id: NCBI taxon id of the sample.  Maybe be a single taxon or mixed taxa sample. Use 'synthetic metagenome’ for mock community/positive controls, or 'blank sample' for negative controls.
@properties.samp_time_out: The recent and long term history of outside sampling
@properties.samp_transport_cond: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C)
@properties.samp_tvdss: Depth of the sample i.e. The vertical distance between the sea level and the sampled position in the subsurface. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples e.g. 1325.75-1362.25 m
@properties.samp_type: The type of material from which the sample was obtained. For the Hydrocarbon package, samples include types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. For the Food Package, samples are usually categorized as food, body products or tissues, or environmental material. This field accepts terms listed under environmental specimen (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001246).
@properties.samp_vol_we_dna_ext: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term Sample Size (MIXS:0000001).
@properties.samp_weather: The weather on the sampling day
@properties.samp_well_name: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken
@properties.saturates_pc: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
@properties.season: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).
@properties.season_environment: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment
@properties.season_precpt: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.
@properties.season_use: The seasons the space is occupied
@properties.secondary_treatment: The process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage
@properties.sediment_type: Information about the sediment type based on major constituents
@properties.seq_meth: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).
@properties.seq_quality_check: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA,ENA or DRA
@properties.sewage_type: Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial
@properties.shad_dev_water_mold: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device
@properties.shading_device_cond: The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling
@properties.shading_device_loc: The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure
@properties.shading_device_mat: The material the shading device is composed of
@properties.sieving: Collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved
@properties.size_frac: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation
@properties.size_frac_low: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample
@properties.size_frac_up: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample
@properties.slope_aspect: The direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., nw or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.
@properties.slope_gradient: Commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer
@properties.sludge_retent_time: The time activated sludge remains in reactor
@properties.soil_horizon: Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath
@properties.soil_text_measure: The relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.
@properties.soil_texture_meth: Reference or method used in determining soil texture
@properties.soil_type: Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998).  Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
@properties.soil_type_meth: Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification
@properties.solar_irradiance: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
@properties.soluble_inorg_mat: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.
@properties.soluble_org_mat: Concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.
@properties.source_mat_id: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).
@properties.space_typ_state: Customary or normal state of the space
@properties.specific: The building specifications. If design is chosen, indicate phase: conceptual, schematic, design development, construction documents
@properties.specific_ecosystem: Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.specific_humidity: The mass of water vapour in a unit mass of moist air, usually expressed as grams of vapour per kilogram of air, or, in air conditioning, as grains per pound.
@properties.sr_dep_env: Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.sr_geol_age: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.sr_kerog_type: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.sr_lithology: Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
@properties.standing_water_regm: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.store_cond: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).
@properties.substructure_type: The substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level
@properties.sulfate: Concentration of sulfate in the sample
@properties.sulfate_fw: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource
@properties.sulfide: Concentration of sulfide in the sample
@properties.surf_humidity: Surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture
@properties.surf_material: Surface materials at the point of sampling
@properties.surf_temp: Temperature of the surface at the time of sampling
@properties.suspend_solids: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances
@properties.tan: Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number)
@properties.target_gene: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies
@properties.target_subfragment: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA
@properties.temp: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling.
@properties.temp_out: The recorded temperature value at sampling time outside
@properties.tertiary_treatment: The process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment
@properties.tiss_cult_growth_med: Description of plant tissue culture growth media used
@properties.toluene: Concentration of toluene in the sample
@properties.tot_depth_water_col: Measurement of total depth of water column
@properties.tot_diss_nitro: Total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen
@properties.tot_iron: Concentration of total iron in the sample
@properties.tot_nitro: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen
@properties.tot_nitro_cont_meth: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen
@properties.tot_nitro_content: Total nitrogen content of the sample
@properties.tot_org_c_meth: Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon
@properties.tot_org_carb: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content
@properties.tot_phosp: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus
@properties.tot_phosphate: Total amount or concentration of phosphate
@properties.tot_sulfur: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample
@properties.turbidity: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles
@properties.tvdss_of_hcr_press: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m).
@properties.tvdss_of_hcr_temp: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m).
@properties.typ_occup_density: Customary or normal density of occupants
@properties.ventilation_rate: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
@properties.ventilation_type: Ventilation system used in the sampled premises
@properties.vfa: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample
@properties.vfa_fw: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource
@properties.viscosity: A measure of oil's resistance¬†to gradual deformation by¬†shear stress¬†or¬†tensile stress (e.g. 3.5 cp; 100 ¬∞C)
@properties.volatile_org_comp: Concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
@properties.wall_area: The total area of the sampled room's walls
@properties.wall_const_type: The building class of the wall defined by the composition of the building elements and fire-resistance rating.
@properties.wall_finish_mat: The material utilized to finish the outer most layer of the wall
@properties.wall_height: The average height of the walls in the sampled room
@properties.wall_loc: The relative location of the wall within the room
@properties.wall_surf_treatment: The surface treatment of interior wall
@properties.wall_texture: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a wall surface
@properties.wall_thermal_mass: The ability of the wall to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete or concrete block that is either exposed or covered only with paint
@properties.wall_water_mold: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a wall
@properties.wastewater_type: The origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.
@properties.water_cont_soil_meth: Reference or method used in determining the water content of soil
@properties.water_current: Measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid
@properties.water_cut: Current amount of water (%) in a produced fluid stream; or the average of the combined streams
@properties.water_feat_size: The size of the water feature
@properties.water_feat_type: The type of water feature present within the building being sampled
@properties.water_prod_rate: Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day)
@properties.water_temp_regm: Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.watering_regm: Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
@properties.weekday: The day of the week when sampling occurred
@properties.win: A unique identifier of a well or wellbore. This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. @properties.salinity_category: Categorical description of the sample's salinity. Examples: halophile, halotolerant, hypersaline, huryhaline
@properties.dna_collect_site: Provide information on the site your DNA sample was collected from
@properties.dna_isolate_meth: Describe the method/protocol/kit used to extract DNA/RNA.
@properties.dna_organisms: List any organisms known or suspected to grow in co-culture, as well as estimated % of the organism in that culture.
@properties.dna_sample_format: Solution in which the DNA sample has been suspended
@properties.dna_sample_name: Give the DNA sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _ only.

@properties.collection_date_inc: Date the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
@properties.collection_time: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point) or interval.
@properties.collection_time_inc: Time the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
@properties.experimental_factor_other: Other details about your sample that you feel can't be accurately represented in the available columns.

@properties.micro_biomass_c_meth: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass carbon
@properties.micro_biomass_n_meth: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass nitrogen
@properties.microbial_biomass_c: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer.
@properties.microbial_biomass_n: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer.
@properties.non_microb_biomass: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g.insect, plant, total. Can include multiple measurements separated by ;
@properties.non_microb_biomass_method: Reference or method used in determining biomass
@properties.org_nitro_method: Method used for obtaining organic nitrogen
@properties.other_treatment: Other treatments applied to your samples that are not applicable to the provided fields
@properties.start_date_inc: Date the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
@properties.start_time_inc: Time the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
@properties.project_id: Proposal IDs or names associated with dataset
@properties.replicate_number: If sending biological replicates, indicate the rep number here.
@properties.sample_shipped: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample sent to EMSL.
@properties.technical_reps: If sending technical replicates of the same sample, indicate the replicate count.

@properties.type: An optional string that specifies the type object.  This is used to allow for searches for different kinds of objects.
@properties.asm_score: A score for comparing metagenomic assembly quality from same sample.
@properties.scaffolds: Total sequence count of all scaffolds.
@properties.scaf_logsum: The sum of the (length*log(length)) of all scaffolds, times some constant.  Increase the contiguity, the score will increase
@properties.scaf_powsum: Powersum of all scaffolds is the same as logsum except that it uses the sum of (length*(length^P)) for some power P (default P=0.25).
@properties.scaf_bp: Total size in bp of all scaffolds.
@properties.scaf_n50: Given a set of scaffolds, each with its own length, the N50 count is defined as the smallest number of scaffolds whose length sum makes up half of genome size.
@properties.scaf_n90: Given a set of scaffolds, each with its own length, the N90 count is defined as the smallest number of scaffolds whose length sum makes up 90% of genome size.
@properties.scaf_l50: Given a set of scaffolds, the L50 is defined as the sequence length of the shortest scaffold at 50% of the total genome length.
@properties.scaf_l90: The L90 statistic is less than or equal to the L50 statistic; it is the length for which the collection of all scaffolds of that length or longer contains at least 90% of the sum of the lengths of all scaffolds.
@properties.scaf_n_gt50k: Total sequence count of scaffolds greater than 50 KB.
@properties.scaf_l_gt50k: Total size in bp of all scaffolds greater than 50 KB.
@properties.scaf_pct_gt50k: Total sequence size percentage of scaffolds greater than 50 KB.
@properties.contigs: The sum of the (length*log(length)) of all contigs, times some constant.  Increase the contiguity, the score will increase
@properties.contig_bp: Total size in bp of all contigs.
@properties.ctg_n50: Given a set of contigs, each with its own length, the N50 count is defined as the smallest number_of_contigs whose length sum makes up half of genome size.
@properties.ctg_l50: Given a set of contigs, the L50 is defined as the sequence length of the shortest contig at 50% of the total genome length.
@properties.ctg_n90: Given a set of contigs, each with its own length, the N90 count is defined as the smallest number of contigs whose length sum makes up 90% of genome size.
@properties.ctg_l90: The L90 statistic is less than or equal to the L50 statistic; it is the length for which the collection of all contigs of that length or longer contains at least 90% of the sum of the lengths of all contigs.
@properties.ctg_powsum: Powersum of all contigs is the same as logsum except that it uses the sum of (length*(length^P)) for some power P (default P=0.25).
@properties.gap_pct: The gap size percentage of all scaffolds.
@properties.gc_std: Standard deviation of GC content of all contigs.
@properties.gc_avg: Average of GC content of all contigs.
@properties.num_input_reads: The sequence count number of input reads for assembly.
@properties.num_aligned_reads: The sequence count number of input reads aligned to assembled contigs.
@properties.id: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI

@properties.samp_vol_we_dna_ext: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term Sample Size (MIXS:0000001).
@properties.nucl_acid_ext: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample
@properties.nucl_acid_amp: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

@properties.target_subfragment: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA
@properties.pcr_primers: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
@properties.pcr_cond: Description of reaction conditions and components of PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'
@properties.seq_meth: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).
@properties.seq_quality_check: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA,ENA or DRA
@properties.chimera_check: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

@properties.ecosystem: An ecosystem is a combination of a physical environment (abiotic factors) and all the organisms (biotic factors) that interact with this environment. Ecosystem is in position 1/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_category: Ecosystem categories represent divisions within the ecosystem based on specific characteristics of the environment from where an organism or sample is isolated. Ecosystem category is in position 2/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_type: Ecosystem types represent things having common characteristics within the Ecosystem Category. These common characteristics based grouping is still broad but specific to the characteristics of a given environment. Ecosystem type is in position 3/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.ecosystem_subtype: Ecosystem subtypes represent further subdivision of Ecosystem types into more distinct subtypes. Ecosystem subtype is in position 4/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.specific_ecosystem: Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.
@properties.principal_investigator: Principal Investigator who led the study and/or generated the dataset.
@properties.title: A name given to the entity that differs from the name/label programmatically assigned to it. For example, when extracting study information for GOLD, the GOLD system has assigned a name/label. However, for display purposes, we may also wish the capture the title of the proposal that was used to fund the study.
@properties.alternative_titles: A list of alternative titles for the entity. The distinction between title and alternative titles is application-specific.
@properties.alternative_descriptions: A list of alternative descriptions for the entity. The distinction between description and alternative descriptions is application-specific.
@properties.alternative_names: A list of alternative names used to refer to the entity. The distinction between name and alternative names is application-specific.
@properties.abstract: The abstract of manuscript/grant associated with the entity; i.e., a summary of the resource.
@properties.objective: The scientific objectives associated with the entity. It SHOULD correspond to scientific norms for objectives field in a structured abstract.
@properties.websites: A list of websites that are associated with the entity.
@properties.publications: A list of publications that are associated with the entity. The publications SHOULD be given using an identifier, such as a DOI or Pubmed ID, if possible.
@properties.type: An optional string that specifies the type object.  This is used to allow for searches for different kinds of objects.
@properties.has_credit_associations: This slot links a study to a credit association.  The credit association will be linked to a person value and to a CRediT Contributor Roles term. Overall semantics: person should get credit X for their participation in the study
@properties.study_image: Links a study to one or more images.

@properties.massive_study_identifiers: identifiers for corresponding study in MASSIVE
